sun.jvm.hotspot.debugger.win32.coff

Interface COFFRelocation


  • public interface COFFRelocation
    Describes a COFF relocation, only present in an object file. (Some of the descriptions are taken directly from Microsoft's documentation and are copyrighted by Microsoft.)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getSymbolTableIndex()
      A zero-based index into the symbol table.
      short getType()
      A value indicating what kind of relocation should be performed.
      int getVirtualAddress()
      Address of the item to which relocation is applied: this is the offset from the beginning of the section, plus the value of the section's RVA/Offset field (see SectionHeader.) For example, if the first byte of the section has an address of 0x10, the third byte has an address of 0x12.

    • Method Detail

      • getVirtualAddress

        int getVirtualAddress()
        Address of the item to which relocation is applied: this is the offset from the beginning of the section, plus the value of the section's RVA/Offset field (see SectionHeader.) For example, if the first byte of the section has an address of 0x10, the third byte has an address of 0x12.

      • getSymbolTableIndex

        int getSymbolTableIndex()
        A zero-based index into the symbol table. This symbol gives the address to be used for the relocation. If the specified symbol has section storage class, then the symbol's address is the address with the first section of the same name.

      • getType

        short getType()
        A value indicating what kind of relocation should be performed. Valid relocation types depend on machine type. See TypeIndicators.
